rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: JOMC 253 is a class where you write a report every week based on the beat you select at the beginning of the semester. Cuadros is really clear on what he wants, is nice and personable, and sympathetic when "life" happens. The class is a significant amount of work no matter who you take it with, but Cuadros made it enjoyable.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Tough grader; you'll be working hard for that B or B+. He's a state politics guru and you'll have a big advantage if you like politics and public policy. Might take some time to get used to his sarcasm and his jokes. But he's a good prof to know in the J school; I'd take at least one class with him.

Story due every week. Requires a lot of work and you will do well,  likely earning a "B" if you adhere to expectations. O'Connor himself said that earning an "A" requires you to devote you life to this class.

Expects students to devote huge amounts of time to the class, assumes each student wants to become a reporter. Lectures more than any journalism professor should. Actually helpful if you see him outside of class, but his grading is very vague and leaves you guessing. Very full of himself, likes to tell his own stories, which are often irrelevant.
